citations.narrative:
On April 11, 2024, a barred owl was unexpectedly startled and escaped from its handler during routine walks. The
individual was adhering to handling procedures but the owl jumped from the glove and the handler lost control of the owl’s
restraint devices. The barred owl was not recovered despite efforts to retrieve it. Escaped animals may suffer physical
harm, trauma, and stress. The facility must address handling to ensure animals are handled as expeditiously and carefully
as possible to minimize these risks. Corrective actions made by the facility included trialing new tethering systems and
creating guidelines and procedures for outdoor raptor equipment and handling, communication, and searches.
Correct on 5/23/24
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
KERI LUPO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
